page.title: 06THE HISTORY OF ALTRINCHAM
page.content: ALTRINCHAM WAS FIRST RECORDED IN THE { {DOMESDAY BOOK.}ALTRINCHAM MEANS HOUSEHOLD OR HOMESTEAD. IN 1084 DUNHAM AND BOWDON WERE MENTIONED; THEY WERE REFERRED TO AS {DONEHAM}AND {BOPALONE} .THE PEOPLE LIVING IN THE AREA WERE SERFS AND THERE WAS A LORD OF THE MANOR. WHEN{HAMON DE MASSEY}WAS LORD OF THE MANOR,{EDWARD 1}GRANTED HIM THE RIGHT TO HOLD A MARKET EACH TUESDAY AND A FAIR THREE TIMES A YEAR. HAMON DE MASSEY GRANTED THE TOWN A {CHARTER} WHICH GAVE PEOPLE THEIR FREEDOM. A COURT WAS SET UP TO GOVERN THE TOWN AND TO ADMINSTER LOCAL JUSTICE. ALTRINCHAM BECAME A {BOROUGH}WHEN THE CHARTER WAS GRANTED.THE NAME GIVEN TO THE COURT WAS THE {COURT LEET. {}
